p: A/Aquatic bird/Korea/W81/2005 (H5N2), isolated from a wild bird in Korea 2006 and kindly provided by Young-Ki Choi of Chungbuk National University, Korea, was adapted by multiple passages (15 times) in Balb/c mice. After the final passage, a single plaque isolated by plaque purification on MDCK cells was amplified in embryonated chicken eggs. The mouse LD 50 of the H5N2 virus was determined for the challenge experiment as described elsewhere [ 41]. The mouse-adapted A/PR/8/34 (PR8) (H1N1) virus was prepared from lung homogenates of intranasally infected mice prior to use for challenge infections.
